text.p: Malaysian infrastructure developer Intria Bhd said on Friday it was proposing a one-for-four rights issue and the issue of 40.8 million new shares to help pay for acquisitions worth a total of 129.6 million ringgit.
The rights will be priced at 1.15 ringgit a share, Intria said in a statement issued by its merchant bankers.
Intria proposed to pay 65.3 million ringgit for the entire issued and paid-up capital of Merdeka Park Holdings Sdn Bhd to be paid by the issue of 40.8 million new shares at 1.60 ringgit each.
Merdeka Park is an investment holding firm with a 70 percent interest in Puncak Vista Sdn Bhd which owns 32.3 acres of land in Kuala Lumpur including two stadiums and the surrounding areas.

Puncak Vista's land is valued at 553 million ringgit. It intends to develop the land within the next seven years into office blocks, a shopping and entertainment centre, hotel and service apartments, condominiums and an amphitheatre. The entire project will be named Plaza Merdeka.
Intria stock was suspended on Friday, being last traded on Thursday at 4.10 ringgit.
In the second proposition, Intria will buy the entire issued and paid-up capital of Pelangi Enterprise Sdn Bhd for 15.3 million ringgit which will be paid in cash.
Pelangi owns 10 units of 3-storey shop offices which have been renovated into a modern hospital.

Under the third proposal, Intria will pay 49 million ringgit for the entire issued and paid-up capital of Peninsula Hospital Sdn Bhd in cash. The company owns a 10-acre plot of land in Kuala Lumpur valued at 48 million ringgit.
Intria said 100 million ringgit of the gross proceeds of about 223.75 million ringgit from the rights issue would be used to repay existing borowings.
Another 100 million ringgit will be used to partially finance the Plaza Merdeka project, and most of the remaining cash to provide additional working capital for the company, said Intria.
